Stem cell.title: Stable clonal contribution of lineage-restricted stem cells to human hematopoiesis
Stem cell.summary: Nature Genetics, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41588-025-02405-wThis study uses somatic mutations as a natural barcoding system to retrospectively and prospectively trace the fate of hematopoietic stem cells across all major blood cell lineages in healthy aged individuals. It reveals the existence of intrinsically fate-biased hematopoietic stem cells in native human hematopoiesis, validated by transplantation assays.
Stem cell.abstract: Dynamic steady-state lineage contribution of human hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) clones needs to be assessed over time. However, clonal contribution of HSCs has only been investigated at single time points and without assessing the critical erythroid and platelet lineages. Here we screened for somatic mutations in healthy aged individuals, identifying expanded HSC clones accessible for lineage tracing of all major blood cell lineages. In addition to HSC clones with balanced contribution to all lineages, we identified clones with all myeloid lineages but no or few B and T lymphocytes or all myeloid lineages and B cells but no T cells. No other lineage restriction patterns were reproducibly observed. Retrospective phylogenetic inferences uncovered a ‘hierarchical’ pattern of descendant subclones more lineage biased than their ancestral clone and a more common ‘stable’ pattern with descendant subclones showing highly concordant lineage contributions with their ancestral clone, despite decades of separation. Prospective lineage tracing confirmed remarkable stability over years of HSC clones with distinct lineage replenishment patterns. This study uses somatic mutations as a natural barcoding system to retrospectively and prospectively trace the fate of hematopoietic stem cells across all major blood cell lineages in healthy aged individuals. It reveals the existence of intrinsically fate-biased hematopoietic stem cells in native human hematopoiesis, validated by transplantation assays.

Stem cell.title_cn: 谱系限制性干细胞对人类造血的稳定克隆贡献
Stem cell.abstract_cn: 人类造血干细胞（HSC）克隆的动态稳态谱系贡献需要进行长期评估。然而，HSC的克隆贡献此前仅在单一时间点进行过研究，且未评估关键的红系和血小板谱系。本研究通过筛查健康老年个体中的体细胞突变，识别出可用于所有主要血细胞谱系追踪的扩增HSC克隆。除了对所有谱系均有平衡贡献的HSC克隆外，我们还发现了一些克隆，它们贡献于所有髓系谱系但缺乏或仅有少量B和T淋巴细胞，或贡献于所有髓系谱系和B细胞但缺乏T细胞。未观察到其他可重复的谱系限制模式。回顾性系统发育推断揭示了一种“分层”模式，其中子代亚克隆比其祖代克隆表现出更强的谱系偏向性；以及一种更常见的“稳定”模式，其中子代亚克隆尽管分离数十年，但与祖代克隆表现出高度一致的谱系贡献。前瞻性谱系追踪证实了具有不同谱系补充模式的HSC克隆在数年内表现出显著的稳定性。本研究利用体细胞突变作为天然条形码系统，回顾性和前瞻性地追踪健康老年个体中造血干细胞在所有主要血细胞谱系中的命运。它揭示了在天然人类造血过程中存在内在命运偏向的造血干细胞，并通过移植实验得到了验证。

Stem cell.title: Human organoids as 3D in vitro platforms for drug discovery: opportunities and challenges
Stem cell.summary: Nature Reviews Drug Discovery, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41573-025-01317-yHuman organoids provide physiologically relevant, 3D models for studying disease mechanisms, drug efficacy and toxicity. This Review examines organoid generation methods, applications in preclinical drug discovery, and the regulatory and practical challenges that must be addressed for their integration into development pipelines.
Stem cell.abstract: Organoids are 3D structures derived from stem cells that recapitulate key architectural and functional aspects of the corresponding tissue. Compared with conventional 2D cell lines, human organoids provide experimental models that more closely reflect human physiology. Their ability to capture the complexity and heterogeneity of human tissues enables the study of disease mechanisms, drug efficacy and toxicity. When generated from patient material, organoids also allow the assessment of individual drug responses. In this Review, we explore the utility of organoids in drug discovery. We outline current methodologies for generating and maintaining organoids, examine their applications in disease modelling, drug screening and safety evaluation, and consider regulatory aspects and the challenges for their broader adoption in drug discovery. Stem cell.title_cn: 人体类器官作为药物发现的三维体外平台：机遇与挑战
Stem cell.abstract_cn: 类器官是源自干细胞的三维结构，能够重现相应组织的关键结构和功能特征。与传统的二维细胞系相比，人体类器官提供了更接近人类生理学的实验模型。它们能够捕捉人体组织的复杂性和异质性，从而有助于疾病机制、药物疗效和毒性的研究。当从患者材料生成时，类器官还可用于评估个体药物反应。本综述探讨了类器官在药物发现中的应用价值。我们概述了当前类器官的生成和维持方法，考察了它们在疾病建模、药物筛选和安全性评估中的应用，并讨论了其在药物发现中更广泛采用所面临的监管问题和挑战。人体类器官为研究疾病机制、药物疗效和毒性提供了生理学相关的三维模型。本综述审视了类器官的生成方法、在临床前药物发现中的应用，以及为将其整合到开发流程中必须解决的监管和实践挑战。

Drug Discovery.title: Structural basis of G6P/Pi transport and inhibition in SLC37A4
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Structural & Molecular Biology, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41594-025-01711-5Zhou et al. report cryo-electron microscopy structures of human SLC37A4 in four states, elucidating conformational transitions during glucose-6-phosphate/phosphate transport and S-4048 inhibition. This study links structural mechanisms to glycogen storage disease type Ib pathology, offering therapeutic insights.
Drug Discovery.abstract: Glycogen storage disease type Ib (GSD-Ib), caused by loss-of-function mutations in the endoplasmic reticulum transporter SLC37A4, disrupts glucose homeostasis through impaired glucose-6-phosphate (G6P)/phosphate (Pi) antiport. Despite its central role in glycogen metabolism and immune regulation, the structural mechanisms governing SLC37A4’s transport cycle and pathological dysfunction remain elusive. Here we report cryo-electron microscopy structures of human SLC37A4 in four functional states, capturing conformational transitions between lumen-facing and cytoplasm-facing states. Combined with mutational analysis, molecular dynamics simulations and functional assays, we identify a conserved substrate-binding pocket that alternately accommodates G6P and Pi through electrostatic complementarity and domain-dependent interactions. We further demonstrate that the high-affinity inhibitor S-4048 sterically occludes the cytoplasmic entry pathway by trapping the transporter in a cytoplasm-facing conformation. Our work elucidates the molecular pathology of GSD-Ib-linked mutations and provides a structural framework for developing therapies targeting this transporter in metabolic diseases. Drug Discovery.title_cn: SLC37A4中G6P/Pi转运及其抑制的结构基础
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 糖原贮积病Ib型（GSD-Ib）是由内质网转运蛋白SLC37A4的功能缺失突变引起的，通过葡萄糖-6-磷酸（G6P）/磷酸（Pi）逆向转运受损，从而扰乱葡萄糖稳态。尽管SLC37A4在糖原代谢和免疫调节中发挥核心作用，但其转运循环和病理功能障碍的结构机制仍不清楚。本研究报道了人源SLC37A4在四种功能状态下的冷冻电镜结构，捕获了其在腔面朝向和胞质面朝向状态之间的构象转变。结合突变分析、分子动力学模拟和功能测定，我们鉴定了一个保守的底物结合口袋，该口袋通过静电互补和结构域依赖性相互作用交替结合G6P和Pi。我们进一步证明，高亲和力抑制剂S-4048通过将转运蛋白捕获在胞质面朝向的构象中，从而空间性地阻断了胞质进入途径。我们的工作阐明了GSD-Ib相关突变的分子病理学，并为开发针对代谢疾病中该转运蛋白的治疗方法提供了结构框架。

Drug Discovery.title: Automated C. elegans behavior analysis via deep learning-based detection and tracking
Drug Discovery.summary: by Xiaoke Liu, Jianming Liu, Wenjie Teng, Yuzhong Peng, Boao Li, Xiaoqing Han, Jing HuoAs a well-established and extensively utilized model organism, Caenorhabditis elegans (C. elegans) serves as a crucial platform for investigating behavioral regulation mechanisms and their biological significance. However, manually tracking the locomotor behavior of large numbers of C. elegans is both cumbersome and inefficient. To address the above challenges, we innovatively propose an automated approach for analyzing C. elegans behavior through deep learning-based detection and tracking. Building upon existing research, we developed an enhanced worm detection framework that integrates YOLOv8 with ByteTrack, enabling real-time, precise tracking of multiple worms. Based on the tracking results, we further established an automated high-throughput method for quantitative analysis of multiple movement parameters, including locomotion velocity, body bending angle, and roll frequency, thereby laying a robust foundation for high-precision, automated analysis of complex worm behaviors. including movement speed, body bending angle, and roll frequency, thereby laying a robust foundation for high-precision, automated analysis of complex worm behaviors. Comparative evaluations demonstrate that the proposed enhanced C. elegans detection framework outperforms existing methods, achieving a precision of 99.5%, recall of 98.7%, and mAP50 of 99.6%, with a processing speed of 153 frames per second (FPS). The established framework for worm detection, tracking, and automated behavioral analysis developed in this study delivers superior detection and tracking accuracy while enhancing tracking continuity and robustness. Unlike traditional labor-intensive measurement approaches, our framework supports simultaneous tracking of multiple worms while maintaining automated extraction of various behavioral parameters with high precision. Furthermore, our approach advances the standardization of C. elegans behavioral parameter analysis, which can analyze the behavioral data of multiple worms at the same time, significantly improving the experimental throughput and providing an efficient tool for drug screening, gene function research and other fields.

Drug Discovery.title_cn: 基于深度学习检测与追踪的秀丽隐杆线虫自动化行为分析
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 秀丽隐杆线虫（C. elegans）作为一种成熟且广泛使用的模式生物，是研究行为调控机制及其生物学意义的重要平台。然而，人工追踪大量秀丽隐杆线虫的运动行为既繁琐又低效。为应对上述挑战，我们创新性地提出了一种基于深度学习检测与追踪的秀丽隐杆线虫自动化行为分析方法。在现有研究的基础上，我们开发了一个增强型线虫检测框架，该框架将YOLOv8与ByteTrack相结合，实现了对多条线虫的实时精确追踪。基于追踪结果，我们进一步建立了一种自动化高通量方法，用于定量分析多种运动参数，包括运动速度、身体弯曲角度和翻滚频率，从而为复杂线虫行为的高精度自动化分析奠定了坚实基础。比较评估表明，所提出的增强型秀丽隐杆线虫检测框架优于现有方法，实现了99.5%的精确度、98.7%的召回率和99.6%的mAP50，处理速度达到每秒153帧（FPS）。本研究开发的线虫检测、追踪和自动化行为分析框架，在提供卓越的检测和追踪精度的同时，增强了追踪的连续性和鲁棒性。与传统劳动密集型测量方法不同，我们的框架支持同时追踪多条线虫，并能高精度地自动化提取各种行为参数。此外，我们的方法推动了秀丽隐杆线虫行为参数分析的标准化，能够同时分析多条线虫的行为数据，显著提高了实验通量，并为药物筛选、基因功能研究等领域提供了高效工具。

Evolution.title: Safeguarding long-term research in ecology and evolution
Evolution.summary: Nature Ecology & Evolution, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41559-025-02897-zLong-term research projects are essential for predicting the ecological and evolutionary responses of species to global change, yet their continuity is often threatened by uncertainties over funding. Evolution.title_cn: 保障生态学与进化领域的长期研究
Evolution.abstract_cn: 长期研究项目对于预测物种对全球变化的生态和进化响应至关重要，然而，它们的持续性却常因资金不确定性而受到威胁。我们采访了法国国家科学研究中心（CNRS）的研究主任Stéphane Blanc，探讨了SEE-LIFE（生态学与进化长期研究）项目及其支持长期监测和研究的优先事项。

Evolution.title: Cellular and molecular mechanisms of seahorse male pregnancy
Evolution.summary: Nature Ecology & Evolution, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41559-025-02883-5Seahorses have a unique sex role reversal with male pregnancy involving the brood pouch, an evolutionarily novel organ. This study uses single-cell genomics and in vivo experiments to reveal the cellular basis and molecular mechanism of pouch development and diversity in seahorses.
Evolution.abstract: Seahorses and their relatives (syngnathids) show a unique sex role reversal. Their male pregnancy is facilitated by an evolutionary novel organ—the brood pouch that functions analogously to the mammalian uterus and placenta despite originating from entirely different tissues. Here we use comparative single-cell multiomics and genomics analyses to investigate the transition from egg laying to pregnancy during syngnathid evolution and compare the convergently evolved life history of placental parental care with that in mammals. In vivo experiments show that a population of epithelial progenitors that possesses pouch-inducing potential and expresses androgen, not female hormones as in other live-bearers, can trigger pouch ontogeny. Two mechanisms ensure functionality of the pouch: recruitment of pseudo-placenta-related cells characterized by expressed orthologous genes also found in mammalian uteri and co-option of specific cells for sticky eggs attached to specialized skin patches of males that express novel seahorse-specific genes such as pastns and syn-lectins. These mechanisms combined drove pouch diversity and complexity in syngnathids. Seahorses have a unique sex role reversal with male pregnancy involving the brood pouch, an evolutionarily novel organ. This study uses single-cell genomics and in vivo experiments to reveal the cellular basis and molecular mechanism of pouch development and diversity in seahorses.

Evolution.title_cn: 海马雄性妊娠的细胞和分子机制
Evolution.abstract_cn: 海马及其近亲（海龙科鱼类）展现出独特的性别角色逆转现象。它们的雄性妊娠由一个进化上新颖的器官——育儿袋所促成，该育儿袋尽管起源于完全不同的组织，但其功能与哺乳动物的子宫和胎盘类似。本研究利用比较单细胞多组学和基因组学分析，探讨了海龙科鱼类进化过程中从产卵到妊娠的转变，并将其趋同进化的胎盘式亲代抚育生命史与哺乳动物进行了比较。体内实验表明，一群具有育儿袋诱导潜能并表达雄激素（而非其他胎生动物中的雌激素）的上皮祖细胞能够触发育儿袋的发生。两种机制确保了育儿袋的功能性：一是招募了以在哺乳动物子宫中也发现的直系同源基因表达为特征的假胎盘相关细胞；二是协同利用了特定细胞，用于将粘性卵附着在雄性特化的皮肤斑块上，这些斑块表达海马特有的新基因，如pastns和syn-凝集素。这些机制共同推动了海龙科鱼类育儿袋的多样性和复杂性。海马具有独特的性别角色逆转现象，其雄性妊娠涉及育儿袋这一进化上新颖的器官。本研究利用单细胞基因组学和体内实验揭示了海马育儿袋发育和多样性的细胞基础和分子机制。

Evolution.title: Evolutionary characterization of antiviral SAMD9/9L across kingdoms supports ancient convergence and lineage-specific adaptations
Evolution.summary: Nature Ecology & Evolution, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41559-025-02845-xA search for analogues of the human SAMD9/9L antiviral genes identifies convergent evolution of this gene family in the bacterial and animal kingdoms, with species-specific and recent genomic signatures indicative of adaptations resulting from evolutionary arms races with viruses.
Evolution.abstract: Human SAMD9 and SAMD9L are duplicated genes that encode innate immune proteins restricting poxviruses and lentiviruses, such as human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). Mutations in these genes are implicated in genetic diseases and cancer. Here we combined structural similarity searches, phylogenetics and population genomics with experimental assays of SAMD9/9L functions to resolve the evolutionary and functional dynamics of these immune proteins, spanning from prokaryotes to primates. We discovered structural analogues of SAMD9/9L in the antibacteriophage defence system, Avs, resulting from convergent evolution. Further, the predicted nuclease site was conserved in bacterial analogues and was essential for cell death, suggesting a fundamental role in defence across different life kingdoms. Despite this shared immunity, we identified genomic signatures of evolutionary arms races in mammals, with remarkable gene copy number variations. We further unveiled that the absence of SAMD9 in bonobos corresponds to a recent gene loss still segregating in the population. Finally, we found that chimpanzee and bonobo SAMD9Ls have enhanced anti-HIV-1 functions compared with the human orthologue. These SAMD9/9L adaptations probably resulted from strong viral selective pressures, including by lentiviruses, and could contribute to lentiviral resistance in bonobos. Evolutionary characterization of Avs9 and SAMD9/9L provides a deeper understanding of how the immune system adapts to fight viruses over billions of years of evolution. A search for analogues of the human SAMD9/9L antiviral genes identifies convergent evolution of this gene family in the bacterial and animal kingdoms, with species-specific and recent genomic signatures indicative of adaptations resulting from evolutionary arms races with viruses.

Evolution.title_cn: 跨界抗病毒SAMD9/9L的演化特征支持古老趋同演化和谱系特异性适应
Evolution.abstract_cn: 人类SAMD9和SAMD9L是编码先天免疫蛋白的重复基因，这些蛋白能限制痘病毒和慢病毒，例如人类免疫缺陷病毒（HIV）。这些基因的突变与遗传疾病和癌症有关。本研究结合结构相似性搜索、系统发育学和群体基因组学，以及SAMD9/9L功能的实验分析，以阐明这些免疫蛋白从原核生物到灵长类动物的演化和功能动态。我们发现，在抗噬菌体防御系统Avs中存在SAMD9/9L的结构同源物，这源于趋同演化。此外，预测的核酸酶位点在细菌同源物中是保守的，并且对细胞死亡至关重要，这表明其在不同生命界域的防御中具有基础性作用。尽管存在这种共享免疫机制，我们仍在哺乳动物中发现了演化军备竞赛的基因组特征，表现出显著的基因拷贝数变异。我们进一步揭示，倭黑猩猩中SAMD9的缺失对应着近期发生的基因丢失，该基因丢失仍在种群中分离。最后，我们发现黑猩猩和倭黑猩猩的SAMD9L与人类直系同源物相比，具有增强的抗HIV-1功能。这些SAMD9/9L的适应性演化可能源于强大的病毒选择压力，包括慢病毒，并可能有助于倭黑猩猩对慢病毒的抵抗力。Avs9和SAMD9/9L的演化特征研究，为我们深入理解免疫系统如何在数十亿年的演化过程中适应并对抗病毒提供了依据。对人类SAMD9/9L抗病毒基因同源物的搜索揭示了该基因家族在细菌界和动物界中的趋同演化，其物种特异性和近期基因组特征表明了与病毒演化军备竞赛所导致的适应性。

Metabolism.title: TSLP links intestinal nutrient sensing with amplification of the ILC2–tuft cell circuit
Metabolism.summary: Nature Immunology, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41590-025-02328-yLocksley and colleagues describe a nutrient-sensing circuit in the small intestine. Upon feeding, TSLP production from fibroblasts is increased in a GLP-2-dependent manner, resulting in increased ILC2 activation and tuft cell hyperplasia, thus linking food intake with ILC2 activation.
Metabolism.abstract: Group 2 innate lymphocytes (ILC2s) are prevalent in small intestine but their role during homeostasis is unclear. Here we show that thymic stromal lymphopoietin (TSLP)—a cytokine implicated in ILC2 activation—is expressed constitutively in subepithelial fibroblasts, including telocytes and crypt-associated trophocytes, which are specialized fibroblasts necessary to sustain epithelial identity. Feeding increases TSLP and induces ILC2 type 2 cytokines that are attenuated by deletion of TSLP in fibroblasts or TSLP receptor on ILC2s. Both mouse and human intestinal fibroblasts express receptors for glucagon-like peptide-2 (GLP-2)—an intestinotrophic growth factor released by enteroendocrine cells following food intake. GLP-2 promotes intestinal TSLP in mouse and human intestinal fibroblasts, and TSLP-dependent ILC2 activation and tuft cell hyperplasia in mice, thus linking nutrient detection with ILC2-mediated amplification of the tuft cell chemosensory circuit that promotes epithelial surveillance of ingested cargo. Locksley and colleagues describe a nutrient-sensing circuit in the small intestine. Upon feeding, TSLP production from fibroblasts is increased in a GLP-2-dependent manner, resulting in increased ILC2 activation and tuft cell hyperplasia, thus linking food intake with ILC2 activation.

Metabolism.title_cn: TSLP介导肠道营养感知与ILC2-簇状细胞回路的放大
Metabolism.abstract_cn: 第二型固有淋巴细胞 (ILC2s) 在小肠中普遍存在，但其在稳态中的作用尚不明确。本研究表明，胸腺基质淋巴细胞生成素 (TSLP)——一种与ILC2活化相关的细胞因子——在包括间隙连接细胞和隐窝相关滋养细胞在内的上皮下成纤维细胞中组成性表达。这些成纤维细胞是维持上皮细胞特性所必需的特化细胞。进食可增加TSLP的表达，并诱导ILC2产生2型细胞因子；而通过敲除成纤维细胞中的TSLP或ILC2上的TSLP受体，可减弱这些效应。小鼠和人肠道成纤维细胞均表达胰高血糖素样肽-2 (GLP-2) 的受体。GLP-2是一种肠道营养性生长因子，在摄食后由肠内分泌细胞释放。GLP-2促进小鼠和人肠道成纤维细胞中肠道TSLP的产生，并促进小鼠体内TSLP依赖的ILC2活化和簇状细胞增生。这表明营养检测与ILC2介导的簇状细胞化学感应回路的放大之间存在关联，该回路促进了对摄入物质的上皮监视。Locksley及其同事描述了小肠中的一个营养感知回路。进食后，成纤维细胞产生的TSLP以GLP-2依赖的方式增加，导致ILC2活化和簇状细胞增生增加，从而将食物摄入与ILC2活化联系起来。

Metabolism.title: Ca<sup>2+</sup>-driven PDIA6 biomolecular condensation ensures proinsulin folding
Metabolism.summary: Nature Cell Biology, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41556-025-01794-8Lee et al. show that Ca²⁺ triggers condensates enriched with PDIA6, an ER-resident disulfide isomerase and chaperone, along with other protein disulfide isomerase family proteins and some chaperones that in turn enhance folding of proinsulin.
Metabolism.abstract: The endoplasmic reticulum (ER) plays crucial roles in maintaining protein quality control and regulating dynamic Ca2+ storage in eukaryotic cells. However, the proteostasis system involved in ER-mediated protein quality control has not been fully characterized. Here we show that Ca2+ triggers the condensation of PDIA6, an ER-resident disulfide isomerase and molecular chaperone, into quality control granules. In contrast to the condensation mechanism observed for proteins containing low-complexity domains, our results indicate that transient but specific electrostatic interactions occur between the first and the third folded thioredoxin-like domains of PDIA6. We further show that the PDIA6 condensates recruit proinsulin, thereby accelerating the oxidative proinsulin folding and suppressing the proinsulin aggregation inside quality control granules, essential for secretion of insulin. Lee et al. show that Ca²⁺ triggers condensates enriched with PDIA6, an ER-resident disulfide isomerase and chaperone, along with other protein disulfide isomerase family proteins and some chaperones that in turn enhance folding of proinsulin.

Metabolism.title_cn: 钙离子驱动的PDIA6生物分子凝聚确保胰岛素原折叠
Metabolism.abstract_cn: 内质网（ER）在维持真核细胞蛋白质质量控制和调节动态钙离子（Ca²⁺）储存方面发挥着关键作用。然而，内质网介导的蛋白质质量控制所涉及的蛋白质稳态系统尚未完全阐明。本研究揭示，Ca²⁺触发了内质网驻留的二硫键异构酶和分子伴侣PDIA6的凝聚，形成质量控制颗粒。与含有低复杂性结构域的蛋白质所观察到的凝聚机制不同，我们的结果表明，PDIA6的第一个和第三个折叠的硫氧还蛋白样结构域之间发生了瞬态但特异性的静电相互作用。我们进一步证明，PDIA6凝聚体能够招募胰岛素原，从而加速氧化性胰岛素原的折叠并抑制质量控制颗粒内的胰岛素原聚集，这对于胰岛素的分泌至关重要。Lee等人研究表明，Ca²⁺触发了富含内质网驻留的二硫键异构酶和伴侣蛋白PDIA6以及其他蛋白质二硫键异构酶家族蛋白和一些伴侣蛋白的凝聚体形成，这些凝聚体进而促进了胰岛素原的折叠。

Metabolism.title: Structural basis of G6P/Pi transport and inhibition in SLC37A4
Metabolism.summary: Nature Structural & Molecular Biology, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41594-025-01711-5Zhou et al. report cryo-electron microscopy structures of human SLC37A4 in four states, elucidating conformational transitions during glucose-6-phosphate/phosphate transport and S-4048 inhibition. This study links structural mechanisms to glycogen storage disease type Ib pathology, offering therapeutic insights.
Metabolism.abstract: Glycogen storage disease type Ib (GSD-Ib), caused by loss-of-function mutations in the endoplasmic reticulum transporter SLC37A4, disrupts glucose homeostasis through impaired glucose-6-phosphate (G6P)/phosphate (Pi) antiport. Despite its central role in glycogen metabolism and immune regulation, the structural mechanisms governing SLC37A4’s transport cycle and pathological dysfunction remain elusive. Here we report cryo-electron microscopy structures of human SLC37A4 in four functional states, capturing conformational transitions between lumen-facing and cytoplasm-facing states. Combined with mutational analysis, molecular dynamics simulations and functional assays, we identify a conserved substrate-binding pocket that alternately accommodates G6P and Pi through electrostatic complementarity and domain-dependent interactions. We further demonstrate that the high-affinity inhibitor S-4048 sterically occludes the cytoplasmic entry pathway by trapping the transporter in a cytoplasm-facing conformation. Our work elucidates the molecular pathology of GSD-Ib-linked mutations and provides a structural framework for developing therapies targeting this transporter in metabolic diseases. This study links structural mechanisms to glycogen storage disease type Ib pathology, offering therapeutic insights.

Metabolism.title_cn: SLC37A4中G6P/Pi转运及其抑制的结构基础
Metabolism.abstract_cn: 糖原贮积病Ib型（GSD-Ib）是由内质网转运蛋白SLC37A4的功能缺失突变引起的，通过葡萄糖-6-磷酸（G6P）/磷酸（Pi）逆向转运受损，从而扰乱葡萄糖稳态。尽管SLC37A4在糖原代谢和免疫调节中发挥核心作用，但其转运循环和病理功能障碍的结构机制仍不清楚。本研究报道了人源SLC37A4在四种功能状态下的冷冻电镜结构，捕获了其在腔面朝向和胞质面朝向状态之间的构象转变。结合突变分析、分子动力学模拟和功能测定，我们鉴定了一个保守的底物结合口袋，该口袋通过静电互补和结构域依赖性相互作用交替结合G6P和Pi。我们进一步证明，高亲和力抑制剂S-4048通过将转运蛋白捕获在胞质面朝向的构象中，从而空间性地阻断了胞质进入途径。我们的工作阐明了GSD-Ib相关突变的分子病理学，并为开发针对代谢疾病中该转运蛋白的治疗方法提供了结构框架。

Metabolism.title: Structural basis of glucose-6-phosphate transport by human SLC37A2
Metabolism.summary: Nature Structural & Molecular Biology, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41594-025-01712-4Lai and Xu et al. used cryo-electron microscopy and functional analyses to elucidate the glucose-6-phosphate uniport mechanism of human solute carrier family 37 member 2 and its structural dynamics, offering insights into glucose metabolism and related disorders.
Metabolism.abstract: Glucose-6-phosphate (G6P) transporters are crucial for glucose metabolism by mediating G6P transport from the cytoplasm to endoplasmic reticulum (ER). However, their transport mechanisms remain poorly understood. Here, we elucidate the structural and functional basis of human solute carrier family 37 member 2 (SLC37A2), a G6P transporter implicated in metabolic regulation and macrophage inflammation. We show that SLC37A2 functions as a uniporter, facilitating G6P transport independent of inorganic phosphate gradients. Structures of SLC37A2 in the apo and G6P-bound states reveal a dimeric architecture. Both the ER luminal-open and cytosolic-open structures are captured, showing the structural dynamics during G6P transport. G6P is coordinated by SLC37A2 through interactions with its phosphate and hydroxyl groups. Furthermore, mapping mutations associated with glycogen storage disease type Ib onto SLC37A2 highlights residues essential for transport activity. Together, this work provides structural insights into G6P transport and establishes a framework for understanding related metabolic disorders. Lai and Xu et al. used cryo-electron microscopy and functional analyses to elucidate the glucose-6-phosphate uniport mechanism of human solute carrier family 37 member 2 and its structural dynamics, offering insights into glucose metabolism and related disorders.

Metabolism.title_cn: 人源SLC37A2介导葡萄糖-6-磷酸转运的结构基础
Metabolism.abstract_cn: 葡萄糖-6-磷酸 (G6P) 转运蛋白通过介导G6P从细胞质向内质网 (ER) 的转运，在葡萄糖代谢中发挥关键作用。然而，其转运机制仍不清楚。本研究阐明了人源溶质载体家族37成员2 (SLC37A2) 的结构和功能基础，SLC37A2是一种与代谢调节和巨噬细胞炎症相关的G6P转运蛋白。我们发现SLC37A2作为一种单向转运蛋白发挥作用，促进G6P转运，且不依赖于无机磷酸梯度。SLC37A2在脱辅基和G6P结合状态下的结构揭示了其二聚体构象。我们捕获了内质网腔开放和胞质开放两种构象，展示了G6P转运过程中的结构动态变化。G6P通过与SLC37A2的磷酸基团和羟基相互作用而被其协调。此外，将与糖原贮积病Ib型相关的突变映射到SLC37A2上，突出了对转运活性至关重要的残基。总而言之，这项工作为G6P转运提供了结构见解，并为理解相关代谢紊乱建立了框架。赖和徐等人利用冷冻电镜和功能分析阐明了人源溶质载体家族37成员2的葡萄糖-6-磷酸单向转运机制及其结构动态，为葡萄糖代谢和相关疾病提供了深入见解。

Biotechnology.title: Automated C. elegans behavior analysis via deep learning-based detection and tracking
Biotechnology.summary: by Xiaoke Liu, Jianming Liu, Wenjie Teng, Yuzhong Peng, Boao Li, Xiaoqing Han, Jing HuoAs a well-established and extensively utilized model organism, Caenorhabditis elegans (C. elegans) serves as a crucial platform for investigating behavioral regulation mechanisms and their biological significance. Plants.title: A combined biochemical and computational approach provides evidence for membrane remodelling by the structural scaffold of the endocytic TPLATE complex
Plants.summary: Nature Plants, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41477-025-02146-yThe manuscript uses an integrative approach to generate a comprehensive structure of the multisubunit endocytic TPLATE complex and to study its membrane targeting and its role in membrane deformation during the initial phase of plant endocytosis.
Plants.abstract: Eukaryotic cells maintain homeostasis of their outer membrane by controlled internalization of lipid and protein constituents via endocytosis. Endocytosis is evolutionary conserved and uses similarly folded domains. How these structural folds are combined into proteins and protein complexes, however, differs between eukaryotic kingdoms. The TPLATE complex (TPC) in plants is an evolutionary ancient protein module that combines several protein domains with a conserved role in endocytosis into a single octameric protein complex. Its molecular architecture, lipid-nucleated condensate formation and requirement for clathrin cage curvature revealed its function in endocytosis initiation in plants. Mechanistic understanding of how this complex drives membrane deformation during plant endocytosis is, however, lacking. Here we used an integrative structural approach to obtain a precise molecular structure of the TPC of Arabidopsis thaliana. In addition, our approach allowed visualizing the structural flexibility that hallmarks this enigmatic complex. We prove that the intrinsic structural flexibility is required for its functionality and membrane recruitment. The membrane-binding interface consists of several domains with differential lipid preferences. Finally, we demonstrate via molecular dynamics simulations that the crescent shape of the structured part of the complex is sufficient for membrane curvature generation. Our mechanistic insight, obtained by a combined biochemical and computational approach, shows that the structured part of the TPC likely contributes to the execution of plant endocytosis, which does not depend on cytoskeletal-based force generation. The manuscript uses an integrative approach to generate a comprehensive structure of the multisubunit endocytic TPLATE complex and to study its membrane targeting and its role in membrane deformation during the initial phase of plant endocytosis.

Plants.title_cn: 结合生化与计算方法揭示内吞TPLATE复合体结构支架介导的膜重塑
Plants.abstract_cn: 真核细胞通过内吞作用受控地内化脂质和蛋白质组分，从而维持其外膜的稳态。内吞作用在进化上是保守的，并利用相似折叠的结构域。然而，这些结构折叠如何组合成蛋白质和蛋白质复合体，在不同真核生物界之间存在差异。植物中的TPLATE复合体（TPC）是一个进化上古老的蛋白质模块，它将多个在内吞作用中具有保守作用的蛋白质结构域组合成一个单一的八聚体蛋白质复合体。它的分子结构、脂质诱导的凝聚物形成以及对网格蛋白笼曲率的需求揭示了其在植物内吞起始中的功能。然而，关于该复合体如何在植物内吞过程中驱动膜变形的机制理解仍然缺乏。在本研究中，我们采用了一种整合结构方法，获得了拟南芥TPC的精确分子结构。此外，我们的方法还能够可视化该神秘复合体所特有的结构柔性。我们证明了其固有的结构柔性对其功能和膜招募是必需的。其膜结合界面由多个具有不同脂质偏好的结构域组成。最后，我们通过分子动力学模拟证明，该复合体结构化部分的月牙形足以产生膜曲率。我们通过结合生化与计算方法获得的机制洞察表明，TPC的结构化部分可能有助于植物内吞作用的执行，且该过程不依赖于细胞骨架产生的力。本文采用整合方法，构建了多亚基内吞TPLATE复合体的全面结构，并研究了其膜靶向及其在植物内吞起始阶段膜变形中的作用。
